metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39928 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the MediaRecorder API of Webkit WebKitGTK 2.40.5. A specially crafted web page can abuse this vulnerability to cause memory corruption and potentially arbitrary code execution. A user would need to to visit a malicious webpage to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8 mdeslaur> It is no longer possible to build new webkit2gtk versions on focal and earlier. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.42.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
